content.description: The tail length of Siberian tigers is approximately normally distributed with a mean of <math alttext="0.85" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.85</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meter and a standard deviation of <math alttext="0.13" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meter.
content.question: Which of the following is the best interpretation of the <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-score for a particular Siberian tiger with a tail length of <math alttext="0.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meter?

choices.label: The tiger’s tail length is approximately <math alttext="0.38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviation below the mean.
The tiger’s tail length is approximately <math alttext="0.38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviation above the mean.

The tiger has an approximate <math alttext="0.38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> probability of having a tail length of <math alttext="0.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meter.
The tiger’s tail length is approximately <math alttext="0.0065" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.0065</mn></math> meter greater than the standard deviation.
The tiger’s tail length is approximately <math alttext="0.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.05</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> meter below the mean.

content.answer: The tiger’s tail length is approximately <math alttext="0.38" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.38</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> standard deviation below the mean.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
